snippet: The mile-and-a-half racetrack at Belmont Park, which has unusual aspects ranging from its length to its running surface, requires a great deal of maintenance.
abstract: Process of maintaining the track at Belmont Park is a tedious one, especially because the mile-and-a-half main track, the longest in North America, looks more like a highway than a place for thoroughbreds; it is a constant battle for the small army charged with its caretaking but all is ready for running of 146th Belmont Stakes.
lead_paragraph: The mile-and-a-half racetrack at Belmont Park, which has unusual aspects ranging from its length to its running surface, requires a great deal of maintenance.

headline.seo: Belmont Park, Site of Failed Triple Crowns, Requires an Army of Caretakers
headline.main: The Complex Battle to Achieve the Perfect Dirt
